attributes.action: Make the Government give more answers to the content within the Coronavirus bill
attributes.additional_details: Give trust back to the people that the Government is there to protect. Stop silencing societies. If the evidence is exists, allow it to be assessed with public scrutiny. No Primary sources of information has supported anything we're told from the government or media. We expect decisions to be made on real open LOGIC, not emotions. We deserve real statical data to be published into the public eye, that do not arise suspicions to the data acquisitions techniques being covered by a new law.
attributes.background: Give substantiated, accountable, transparent & fully traceable evidence and information based on PRIMARY SOURCES from real scientists to justify the drastic laws enforced through parliament so quickly! Give back a true Democracy! Trump has accused the WHO of corruption. Need Real independent info.

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about the basis on which the Coronavirus Act 2020 was passed, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do.

Since you started your petition the Government has published the minutes from the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies, which has informed the Government's response to coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-publishes-sage-minutes

If there is other material you want the Governemnt to publish, you could start a new petition requesting this.

We have also published a petition calling on the Government to repeal the Coronavirus Act 2020, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313310

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
